text: Daryl Frank Dragon (August 27, 1942 â€“ January 2, 2019) was an American musician and songwriter. He was known as Captain from the pop musical duo Captain & Tennille, with his former wife, Toni Tennille.Profile , Music- enthusiast.com; accessed August 24, 2016. == Biography == In 1981, Dragon contributed to Carpenters' Made In America album, programming synthesizers on "(Want You) Back In My Life Again". In 1996, Dragon played keyboard on a number of tracks on the self-titled album by pop punk band Size 14. In 2009, Dragon was diagnosed with a neurological disorder which causes him to have tremors. Dragon died on January 2, 2019 in Prescott, Arizona from renal failure at the age of 76.Daryl Dragon of Captain and Tennille Dies at 76 NBC Miami, January 2, 2019 ==References== Category:1942 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from renal failure Category:American pianists Category:American guitarists Category:American songwriters Category:Musicians from Los Angeles Category:Writers from Los Angeles
title: Daryl Dragon
